artciles.quiztitle: Quiz for Artificial Neural Networks-Perceptron Learning

artciles.q: Correlation learning law is special case of?
artciles.description: Since in hebb is replaced by bi(target output) in correlation.

artciles.q: Correlation learning law is what type of learning?
artciles.description: Supervised, since depends on target output.

artciles.q: Correlation learning law can be represented by equation?
artciles.description: Correlation learning law depends on target output(bi).

artciles.q: The other name for instar learning law?
artciles.description: The unit which gives maximum output, weight is adjusted for that unit.

artciles.q: The instar learning law can be represented by equation?
option: ∆wij= µ(bi – si) aj Á(xi),where Á(xi) is derivative of xi
∆wk= µ (a-wk), unit k with maximum output is identified
artciles.answer: ∆wk= µ (a-wk), unit k with maximum output is identified
artciles.description: Follows from basic definition of instar learning law.

artciles.q: Is instar a case of supervised learning?
artciles.description: Since weight adjustment don’t depend on target output, it is unsupervised learning.

artciles.q: The instar learning law can be represented by equation?
option: ∆wjk= µ(bj – wjk), where the kth unit is the only active in the input layer
∆wij= µ(bi – si) aj Á(xi),wher Á(xi) is derivative of xi
artciles.answer: ∆wjk= µ(bj – wjk), where the kth unit is the only active in the input layer
artciles.description: Follows from basic definition of outstar learning law.

artciles.q: Is outstar a case of supervised learning?
artciles.description: Since weight adjustment depend on target output, it is supervised learning.

artciles.q: Which of the following learning laws belongs to same category of learning?
artciles.description: They both belongs to supervised type learning.

artciles.q: In hebbian learning intial weights are set?
artciles.description: Hebb law lead to sum of correlations between input & output, inorder to achieve this, the starting initial weight values must be small.

artciles.q: Why do we need biological neural networks?
option: to solve tasks like machine vision & natural language processing
to make smart human interactive & user friendly system
artciles.description: These are the basic aims that a neural network achieve.

artciles.q: What is the trend in software nowadays?
option: to bring computer more & more closer to user
artciles.answer: to bring computer more & more closer to user
artciles.description: Software should be more interactive to the user, so that it can understand its problem in a better fashion

artciles.q: . What’s the main point of difference between human & machine intelligence?
option: human perceive everything as a pattern while machine perceive it merely as data
artciles.answer: human perceive everything as a pattern while machine perceive it merely as data
artciles.description: Humans have emotions & thus form different patterns on that basis, while a machine(say computer) is dumb & everything is just a data for him.

artciles.q: What is auto-association task in neural networks?
artciles.description: This is the basic definition of auto-association in neural networks..

artciles.q: Does pattern classification belongs to category of non-supervised learning?
artciles.description: Pattern classification belongs to category of supervised learning.

artciles.q: In pattern mapping problem in neural nets, is there any kind of generalization involved between input & output?
artciles.description: The desired output is mapped closest to the ideal output & hence there is generalisation involved.

artciles.q: What is unsupervised learning?
option: number of groups may be known
neither feature & nor number of groups is known
artciles.answer: neither feature & nor number of groups is known
artciles.description: Basic definition of unsupervised learning.

artciles.q: Does pattern classification & grouping involve same kind of learning?
artciles.description: Pattern classification involves supervised learning while grouping is an unsupervised one.

artciles.q: Does for feature mapping there’s need of supervised learning?
artciles.description: Feature mapping can be unsupervised, so it’s not a sufficient condition.

artciles.q: Example of a unsupervised feature map?
artciles.description: Since same vowel may occur in different context & its features vary over overlapping regions of different vowels.
